snippet: Linda E. McMahon, a Republican, has broken a record, long having surpassed Ross Perot in personal spending to seek a federal office.
abstract: Linda E McMahon, a Republican candidate for Senate in Conn, has spent close to $100 million for two Senate races over the past three years, far more than anyone has ever spent of their own money to win any federal seat; she had outspent current opponent, Democrat Christopher S Murphy, by more than four to one by September.

byline.contributor: Elizabeth Maker, Jo Craven McGinty and Derek Willis contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Linda E. McMahon, a Republican, has broken a record, long having surpassed Ross Perot in personal spending to seek a federal office.

headline.seo: Linda E. McMahon Has Spent Nearly $100 Million in Senate Races
headline.main: Personal Cost for 2 Senate Bids: $100 Million
headline.print_headline: Personal Cost for 2 Senate Bids: $100 Million
